title: Relates to the brownfield redevelopment tax credit
summary: Relates to the brownfield redevelopment tax credit; provides that in the event that the qualified site is owned by, or was acquired by a taxpayer from, a municipality and such municipality is a volunteer under the brownfield site clean-up agreement with respect to such qualified site, then the amount of the credit shall be reduced; defines "infrastructure work"; makes related amendments.

   23  COSTS  OF  ALL INFRASTRUCTURE WORK, AS DEFINED BELOW, UNDERTAKEN SPECIF-

   43  year in which the effective date of the issuance  of  a  certificate  of

   46  completion shall be allowed in the taxable year such qualified costs are

   48  such certificate of completion.

   17    (3) Qualified tangible  property.  "Qualified  tangible  property"  is
   18  property  described  in either subparagraph (A) or (B) of this paragraph

   20    (A) (i) is depreciable pursuant to section one hundred sixty-seven  of
   21  the internal revenue code,
   22    (ii) has a useful life of four years or more,

   26  PAYMENT PURSUANT TO PARAGRAPH ONE OF SUBDIVISION (A) OF THIS SECTION,

   28    (v) is principally used by the taxpayer  for  industrial,  commercial,

   31    (B)(i) is, or when occupied becomes, part of a dwelling whose  primary

   35    (ii)  has been acquired by purchase (as defined in section one hundred
   36  seventy-nine (d) of the Internal Revenue Code) BY THE  TAXPAYER  OR  THE
   37  MUNICIPALITY  (OR  ANY  AFFILIATED  MUNICIPALITY  THEREOF) ENTITLED TO A
